[...] [x x-x]-s,a# be-li2-ia ia-nu [...] u3 2(disz) _erin2-hi-a_ bu-ri a-na hu-[ur-ru? ...] i-na-na-ma _{gesz}kiri6_ i-na _u4 5(disz)-kam#_ [...] ki-i kul-li-[zu] i-s,i _{gesz}kiri6_ [...] it-ta-ak#?-[su? ...] i-na-an-na ki i-tab-la a-na ki ma2-s,i u4-mi a-na [...] i-tu-ur-ra 2(disz) _erin2-hi-a_ sza ak-lu-u2 bu-ri li-[ih-ru ...] u3 me-e a-na da-li-i li-id-[di]-nu-ma _e2_ na-pisz-ta5 [...] _u4-1(disz)-kam_ nap#-har _erin2-hi-a_ a-na _{i7}bad3-{d}iszkur{ki}_ ul-te-bi-ir _{i7}bad3-{d}iszkur{ki}_ a-di _u4 1(u)-kam_ usz-ta-[na]-as-sa#-ha#-ma# me-e e-pe2-et-te a-na pa-an-_edin_ sza al-li-[ka? har-bi? sza?] _ensi2-hi-a_ sza _uru_-{d}nin-urta-mu-bal-li2-it,[...] re-e-sza ki-i asz-szu-u2 il-te#-en#-nu-u2 zu-[...] i-na mu-uh-hi al-ta-ta-ka-an u3 5(disz)# x [...] a-na il-te-en-nu-u2 a-wi-le-e ma-nu-ti [...] _gu4-hi-a_ sza {disz}ib-ni-{d}kur sza 6(disz) har-bi ki-i a-ma#?-ru szum#-ma# a-na bu-ul-lu-[li] im-me2-esz-szi-lu [...]-me#-ma lu-u2 _{gesz#}kiri6_-ru-um-ma i-sza-ta-ti [...]-ak-ku-nu u3 _gu4-hi-a {iri}bad3-{d}marduk{ki}_ [...] 3(u) 1(disz) har-bi ki-i a-mu-[ru?] i-[...]-na-ap?-szu-nu-ti _geme2 ARAD_-ka szu-nu-ti la# [...] 6(disz) har-bu da-an-ni-isz szu-[...] [...] {disz}tu-kul-ti-_{d}kur_ ki-i a-mu-ru-ma a-[...] [...] _gu4#-hi-a_ da-an-nu-ma a-a-u2 _uru_ tu-nu-[...] [... de]-ke-e _numun_ um-mu#-ru sza _uru_-re-e-i{ki} [...] [i-na? _sze?]-numun_ de-e-ki [...] _sze-numun_ uh-hu-ur u3 _numun_ [...] [u2]-du-u2-szu a-di ki-[...]-i# i-na de-ke-e u2-ni-x?-[x-x?] [...]-ir _numun_ [...] _lu2_ ha-[...]-i-di 2(u) 2(asz) _gur#_ [...] [...] _ARAD_ [...] ri!#-ik-su [...]-re-e li#-bar-ru#? [...] gi#-ti _hi-a#?_ [...]
en: ... ...(pl.) confinement# ? ... ... of my lord is lacking. ... and two ṣābu workers for the digging of wells ... And now on the 5 th day the garden ... when the ox driver has chopped (?) wood from the garden ... Now, when he carried it off-for how many days to ... will he return? May the two workers, who I have detained, dig wells, so that they may give water for drawing and so that the house may? live. On the first day I let the total of the workers repeatedly cross back and forth over the Dūr-Adad canal (= i.e. to check which parts need redigging/repair?). I will have the Dūr-Adad canal dug up until the 1 0 th day and I will open the water for the pīḫātu Pān-ṣēri. Regarding the fact that I wen[t to (the ḫarbu fields of ?)] the iššakku farmers of the city Āl-Ninurta-muballiṭ ... when I checked the number of men, then each one ... (on the fields/canals) there I placed each of them and then 5(disz) ... to each man, who was counted, ... when I had inspected (?) the cattle of Ibni-Amurru, the ones of the six ḫarbu fields, and when# to scatter (them on the fields) they had divided them evenly (i.e. between the fields), are [...] filled with [wa]ter. In the garden(s) are fires your (Pl. m) ... and the cattle of the city Dūr-Marduk ... when I inspected 3 1 ḫarbu fields ... he ... them don ’t ... your female and male servants 6(disz) ḫarbu fields strongly ... ... after/that I saw Tukultī-Amurru and ... "the [...] cattle is strong. And which city have you [...] [... in order to co]llect (levies) the seeds are inspected (?). Regarding the city Āl-rē’î: out of? (the barley) seeds of the dēkû officials ... barley seeds remain and seeds ... [(in?)] his [sa]ck(s) ... until ... in the collecting of levies he did ... ... seeds? ... the (person) ... 22 gur ... ... servant ... the riksu preparation (for the offering) ... he may observe# ? ...

akk: [...] di# _numun_-u2 a-na me-e za-la-[...] [...] it-tu-u2 u3 mu-u2 i-na bu-ri-[i? ...] [...]-ma i-sza-ap-pi2-lu _{gesz#!}kiri6-mesz_ am-mi-ni _lu2_-{d}[...] [...] a-na _{gesz}kiri6-mesz_ a-na-ku a-nam-din asz-szu14 {i7}bad3-{d}iszkur{ki} [...] sza be-li2 isz-pu-ra um-ma-a _{iti}sig4-a {iti}szu-numun-na_ [...] u3 _{iti}ne-gar_ he-ra-a ki#-i# aq-ba-ak-ku! ul te-eh-ri [...] _{i7}bad3-{d}iszkur{ki}_ ab-la-at [ma?]-a ul ah-ri [lu]-u2 ab-la-at i-na _{iti}sig4-a_-ma i-na he-re-e ug-dam-mi-ir# [...] i#-na-an-na-ma a-na a-ba-li [uh]-hu-ra-at _nig2-szid_-ia [...] [... i]-na _ka2-dingir-ra{ki}_ be-li2 ki-i [i-mu-ru] sza ul-tu _{iti}sig4-a_ [a]-di _{iti}ne-gar_ qa2-nu-u2 a-[...] i-na-na be-li2 li-tu-ur-ma [... li]-pu-usz-ma ul-tu qa2-nu# u2#?-qat-tu-u2 be-li2 ki li-ib-bi-szu li#-[pu-usz]-sza-an-ni [a]-na mi#-ni#-i _erin2-hi-a_ ri-iq-ma u3 a-na-ku a-da-gal asz-szu14 {iri}e-mu-qa2-at-_{d}marduk_ sza be-li2 isz-pu-ra um-ma-a asz-szu14 la i-ri-szu ut,-t,e4-ta li-si-ru-szu i-na {iri}e-mu-qa2-at-_{d}marduk_ be-li2 _i7_ ul ih-ra-a a-na-ad-di ki-i ir-ri-isz u3 lu _erin2-hi-a_ a-na pa-ni-ia mu#-usz#!-szur#?-szu# um-ma-a i-na _erin2-hi-a_ _i7_ ki la te-eh-ri-ma# la te-ri-isz lu _e_ lu _i7_ hal-pu i-na ba-lu4 be-li2-ia ul e-he-[er]-ri i-na-an-na _erin2-hi-a_ a-na pa-ni-ia mu-usz-szur-ma u3# dul#-li# ra#-ma#?-ni#-ia i-na _sza3_ i-qa2-ab-ba a-tasz-bu [...] be-li2 a-na tu#-[ur-ri-x] um-ma-a ki-i dul-la an-ni-a-am i-na ra-ma-[ni-ka] te-pu-szu _i7#_ [...]-szu-{d}marduk# ki-i la te-eh-[ri ...] _erin2-hi-a_ be-li2 ki-i re-qi2#? ul i-di-nam ki-i la hi-t,u2-u2 _erin2#-[hi-a?] ut,-t,e4-ta sza be-li2 le-qa2-a iq-bu-u2 i-le-qu2-ma sza be-li2-ia-ma u3 _ninda_-szu-ma sza be-li2-ia-ma ki-i ib-te-ru-u2 i-na _e2_ be-li2-ia ip-ra-a ul a-ma-har asz-szu14 _ansze-kur-ra_ sza be-li2 isz-pu-ra um-ma-a _ansze-kur-ra_ sza ad-di-na-ku szu-bi-la12 a-a-u2-tu# _ansze-kur-ra_ sza be-li2-ia-ma a-a-u2-tu at-tu-u2-a a-na-ku# _ansze#-kur-ra_ sza be-li2-ia a-ki ki-na-tu-u2-a _sipa ansze-kur-ra-[mesz_ ...] s,a-ab-tu-ma _ansze-kur-ra_ sza an-na-an-na i-qab-bu [...] u3 _ansze-kur-ra_ sza be-li2-ia ma-a-di i-tu-u2-[a ...]
en: ... the seeds to water ... ... with me? and water in the well ... ... and they will go deep. Why has Amīl-... the gardens ...? I have given for the gardens. Regarding the Dūr-Adad canal, ... which my lord wrote to me about the following: “Because in the month simanu, the month du’ūzu, .. . and the month abu the digging, which I had ordered you to do, you did not dig (because of that) ... The Dūr-Adad canal has dried up.” All I can say is: I have not dug. It may dry up, since I have completed the digging in the month simanu already. ... Now# it has been left there to dry up. My account was ... when my lord inspected it ... in Babylon. Regarding the fact that from the month simanu until the month abu reed has .... Now my lord may return and ... he may act upon it. After he will have finished (off) the reed, my lord may treat me according to his heart. Why are the worktroops idle and I have to wait? Regarding the city Emūqāt-Marduk, which my lord wrote to me about the following: Because he has not cultivated, they may collect barley from him. In the city Emūqāt-Marduk my lord has not dug the nāru canal. I will let it lie fallow. When he wants to cultivate it, then it might be the case that the workers,which were (assigned) for me, are already set free for him. The following: "Because with the help of the workers you did not dig a canal and you did not cultivate, because of that either the iku irrigation canal or the nāru canal are covered (?)." Without my lord(' s permission) I will not dig. Now the workers,which had been (assigned) to me, are set free. Therefore my dullu work duty, that of myself, according to (his) heart/mind, he will order (me to do).  I have been staying here (waiting) for my lord to return. The following: "When you performed this dullu work duty on your own ( = in that of yourself) you did not dig the canal …šu-Marduk." When the workers of my lord were idle, then he did not give. But because it was not the offence of the workers (?) they will take the barley, which my lord ordered them to take: That of my lord (i.e. from his stocks) and his bread, that of my lord. Whenever they are hungry don’t I (usually) receive rations from the house of my lord? Regarding the horses,which my lord wrote to me the following about: "The horse, which I gave to you, let it be brought to me!" Which horses are the ones of my lord and which ones are mine? I have the horses of my lord, as well as of my servants and the shepherds of the horses .... They have been seized and the horses of so and so, which he spoke about, are ... and the horses of my lord are numerous. By my side ...

akk: [...] ir-te-mu-ka a!-a-ka-a nu-ba-'a-a-szu-nu-ti _edin_ i#?-ma-al?-lu
en: ... has mercy with you. Where shall we search for them? The steppe will be filled ...

akk: [asz-szu14] hu#-us,-s,i-ti sza be-li2 isz-pu-ra la#? [...] [...]-u2 _1(gesz2) 2(u) ninda_ e-te-sir u3 szu-ra [sza] i-na _e2_ {disz}er-ri-gi na-ak-su [... a]-na# na-sze-e pa-al-ha-ku a-na-asz-szi-ma ik-ki-mu [a]-na# _e i7_ i-tab-ba-ku-ma mi-na-a ip-pu-usz {disz}ki-din-_{d}iszkur dumu_ {disz}a-na-ka-la-ma-_{d}iszkur lu2-sag-lugal#_ sza i-na _ugu {gesz}kiri6-mesz_ sza {iri}u2-pi-i sza-ak-nu# [...] _{lu2}nu-{gesz}kiri6 sza be-li2-ia ir-ta-pi-is u3 ul-te-eb#-[bi-ir-szu] um-ma-a be-el-ka i-na ba-lu-u2 ki-ki-ia u3 a-di-na _gesz-hi-a_ a-na _lugal_ ul a-na-ak-ki-is u3 szu-u2 _gesz-hi-a_ i-na-ak-ki-is _nu-[{gesz}]kiri6_ an-ni-ta iq-ta-ba-asz-szu um!-ma-a isz-tu [(_gesz?_) na-ak-su?] be-li2 x [...] [...]-a-ba i-na _{gesz}kiri6_-szu u3# [...] [...] 2(u) _ki-mesz_ [...]
en: Regarding the reed fence, which my lord wrote to me about: Don’t ... .... I have already enclosed 80 ninda and the reed bundles, which were cut on the estate of Errigu. I am worried about bringing them. I will bring them and they will pile them up and they will spill them into the iku irrigation canals and the main nāru canal. What shall he (= one) do? Kidin-Adad, the son of Ana-kalāma-Adad, the ša rēši šarri ..., who is assigned ... in the gardens of Upī, has beaten the gardener of my lord and he injured him severly! The following: How is your lord doing without me? And I have not yet chopped the wood for the king. But he, on the other hand, will chop wood. The gardener has told this to him, the following: “After it (= the wood) is chopped my lord ... ... in his garden ... ... “

akk: _ARAD_-ka {disz}u-bar-ru3 a-na di-na-an be-[li2-ia lul-lik] um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia-a-ma a-na _a-sza3_ u3 _lu2-{gesz}apin_ sza be-li2-ia szu-ul-mu i-na pu-ut _a-sza3-mesz_ [...] sza _tukul_-kul-ti-_e2_-kur{ki} sza be-[li2-ia] isz-pu-ra ik-te-di-ir [...] u3 _erin2-hi-a_ sza _ensi2-mesz_ u? szu#-[ta-pi?]-e isz-tu4 _i7 tukul_-kul-ti-_e2_-kur{ki} a-di u2-ga-re-e sza ta-mi-ir-ti ha-am-ri sza i-na mi-li ma-ha-ri-i mu-u2 is,-ba-tu-ma ip-ti-nu-ma iz-zi-zu ih-ta-tu-ni u3 har-bu sza {disz}bu-ur-ru-ti sza i-na ta-mi-ir-ti ha-am-ri za-ku dul{ul}-la ul i-pu-usz mu-u2 ma-hu-ru-u2-tu4 _ad#?_-[...]-x? u3 _erin2-hi-a_ sea be-li2-ia dul#?-[la ...]
en: Your servant Ubāru: I m ay go as my lord's substitute! The following (say) to my lord: Regarding the fields and the ikkaru farmers of my lord: Everything is order. On the head side/small side of the fields ... of Tukultī-Ekur, which my lord wrote to me about,he has established a border ... and the workers of the iššakku farmers and the šutāpu workmen have neglected their work from the Tukultī-Ekur canal up to the ugāru land (intended for farming) in the irrigated territories (belonging to the city) of the Ḫamru irrigation districts,which the water in the previous seasonal flooding had seized, then became firm there, and then stood there. Furthermore the ḫarbu fields of Burrutu, which are in the irrigated territories (of to the city) of Ḫamru, are exempted from levies. He does not need to fulfil the dullu work duty. The previous water ..., and the ṣābu workers of my lord the d[ullu work duty? …]

akk: [...] [...] [...] [...] sza _bad3_-{d}en-lil2-_mesz{ki}_ [...] mi#-ik#-su# sza#? [...] li-isz-pu-ra-am#-ma [...] [...] [...] um-ma-a a-na be-li-ia#? [...] [...] _e2_ sza be-li2 isz-pu-ra a-na be-li2-[ia] usz-te-bi-la
en: ... ... ... ... of Dūr-Enlilē ... the miksu of# ... he may send here# and ... ... ... The following to my lord ... ... house ... he wrote about ... of the house of my lord to my lord. I/he has let them bring here.

akk: [a-na be]-li2#-ia# [qi2-bi2-ma] [um-ma] {disz}_lu2-{d}marduk_# [_ARAD2_-ka] [a-na] di#-na-an be-li2-ia [lul-lik um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia-ma] [...]-id _i7_ ki-i il-li-ku# [...] mi-il kisz-sza-ti uh-hu-[ur ... _a]-sza3#?_ 3(disz)? [...] [in?]-na#-ah-su nam-kar-si-mat-{d}[en]-lil2# u3 nam-kar-_nibru[{ki}_] [e-pe]-et#-te _3(u) gur numun_ sza im-lu#-u2# ki#-i _i7_ ih-hi-su# [me-e?] il-ta#-ka-an x-x-x [... i-na] _i7#_ e-tel-pi# [...] [...]-i _i7_ hasz-mar-gal-[du ... me-e?] a-di-na ul isz-sza-ka-nu-ma [i?]-te#?-ni-lu u3 _pa5_-{d}[x]-ra ul ip-te [...]-ni-ti sza be-li2 isz-[pu?-ra?] um-ma-a hi-sza-ti [pe?]-ti mu-u2 a-di-na i-na [hi]-sza#-a-ti [ul] isz-sza-ka-nu sza {d}er3#-ra#-ga-[mil] ta#-mi-ir-tu _bara2-szesz{ki}_ ma-la-at [u3] 2(u) gur _numun ki-sza-di i#-[na] pa-an _i7# bara2#-szesz{ki} gu2-gal_ me-e ip-te-te-e-ma il#-la#-ku sza na-at-[ba]-ak-ti me-e ul-tu nam-kar _{disz}du3#_-sza-_{d}marduk_ ki-i ip-tu-u2 mi-s,u2 _a-sza3_ {d}er3-ra-ga-mil i#-ma-la-a?-ma# na-at-ba-ak-ta e-se-ke-er-ma me-e [sza?] _i7_ [nam]-gar-{d}en-lil2{ki} a-na na-at-ba-ak-ti e#-[pe]-et#-te# i-na-an-na e-pe-et-te-ma mu-u2 ul-tu na-at-ba-ak#-ti# sza {d}er3-ra-ga-mil li-s,u2-ni sza [ka]-le#-e sza na-at-ba#-ak#-ti qa2-nu-u2 sza 5(disz) har-bu sza _ensi2-mesz_ sza _{disz}{dingir}marduk#-uri3#_ na-di i-na a-sza-ab be-li2-ia a-na be-li2-ia al-tap-ra [u3] i#-na-an-na a-na be-li2-ia al-tap-ra ki-i qa2-nu-u2 na-du-u2 _gu4#-mesz#_ sza# er-re-szi u3 _ensi2-mesz_ ki-i u2-qa2-ri-bu i-te-lu#? i#-na# t,u2-bi be-li2 li-ik-szu-da-am-ma [...] a#-na# _{disz}{dingir}marduk-uri3_ szum-ma i-na ka-le-e# [u3?] szum-ma i-na# hi-ru-ti sza3# be-li2 i-na-da-asz-szu li-[pu]-usz [sza be]-li2 isz-pu#-ra um#-ma#-a tup-pa#?-ka-sza# [ik]-szud
en: Speak to my lord: The following (says) Amīl-Marduk, [your servant] I may go as my lord's substitute! (Speak) the following to my lord: a ... when the nāru canal was running ..., the flood in its totality is late ... the field (of) three (?) ... Because (?) it was withheld, I will open the namgāru canal Namkar-Simat-Enlil and the namgāru canal Namkar-Enlil. (Because) it was 30 (gur) seeds (cropland 300 iku = 243 ha), which they had filled (= seeded ?), when the nāru canal ran dry, he had placed water (there). (But) ... in the nāru canal of Etel-pû ... ... the nāru canal of Ḫašmar-galdu ... water has not been placed (in there) until now and he repeatedly went (away) and he did not open the atappu/palgu-ditch of ...ra. .... Regarding that,which my lord has written about: “The following: Open the weirs!” Until now they have not placed water in (the upstream side of) the weirs. Regarding Irra-gāmil: the tamirtu land of Parak-aḫi is filled (with seeds). And (it is) 20 (gur) seeds (cropland 200 iku = 162 ha) at the bank of the river in front of the nāru canal of Parak-aḫi. Then the canal inspector has opened the waters and they run. Regarding the natbaktu-reservoir: When they had opened the water out of the namgāru canal of Banâ-ša-Marduk, it was too little. It will fill the fields of Irra-gāmil, but then I will close the natbaktu-reservoir and I will open water from the nāru canal Namkar-Enlil for the natbaktu-reservoir. Now, I will open (the natbaktu reservoir) and water out of the natbaktu-reservoir of (for) Irra-gāmil may go out. Regarding the kalû-dikes of the natbaktu-reservoir: The reed of 5 ḫarbu fields of the iššakku farmers of Marduk-nāṣir is thrown (down). I have written to my lord when my lord was residing (in his residence?), and now I have written to my lord again. After the reed was thrown down and after they had driven the cows of the erreszu and iššakku here, (after that) they left. My lord may kindly arrive here. And ... regarding Marduk-nāṣir, when in the kalû-dikes and when in the digging work, what my lord throws down for him, he may do! [Regarding what] my [l]ord wrote to me: The following: If I (according to ?) your tablet, which arrived(?)

akk: i-na-an-na-a me-e a-na na-at-ba-ak-ti e-pe-te-ma#? mu-u2 a-na _uru_ {d}er3-ra-ga-mil ul ir-ru-bu#-ma#? me-e a-na na-at-ba-ak-ti e-pe-te-ma a-na _bad3_-{d}en-lil2-_hi-a{ki}_ ki-i ir-ru-bu u3 ka-lu-u2 ul e-pu-usz ta-mi-ir-ta sza _bad3#_-{d#}en#-lil2#-_hi-a_ be-li2 ki i-mu-ru a-ka-an-na iq-ta-[ba um-ma]-a szu-ru da-an ma-am-ma la [...] a-na be-li2-ia# a-ka-an-na aq#-[ta-ba um-ma]-a _a-sza3-mesz_ a-na [...] har-bi sza _bad3_-{d}en-lil2-_hi-a[{ki}_ ... be?]-li2 a-ka-an-na iq-[ta-ba]-a um-ma-a u3 szu-nu x [...] ta#-ra-bi isz-[sza?-ka?-an?-nu? ...] u3 _bad3-{d}nusku{ki}_ [... er]-re#?-szu [...] sza pi-hat _bad3-{d}en#-[lil2 _hi-a_ ...] ka-la-a sza ta-mi#-[ir-ti ...] te#? [...] ki-i id-du-ni-szu-nu#-[ti? ...] szu#? [...] li-sze-lu-u2 [...]-ma _a-sza3_ [...] la i-ma-as, i-na# [...] sza be-li2-[ia ...] [...]-ri sza [...] [...] i#-ni-[...] [...]{ki} um-ma-a a#-na {disz}ib-ni-_{d}kur#_ [... be]-li2 i-sza-pa-ra-am# [... i]-da-ga#-lu i-na sza-at-ti [...]-na-a sza s,a-ab-tu [...] du-ul-la an-na-a [...] e-bu-ri _erin2-mesz_ [...]-le-e iz-zi-zu [...] na-at-ba-ak-tu#? [...]-szar#? a#-na#? 4(u) _numun_ [...]-i-di ul-tu s,a-ab-tu [it]-ti-il-tu [...] i-mi-ki-ru [e]-le-nu-usz-szu u3# [...] [...] ki-i sza be-li2 i-sza-pa-[ra ...]
en: if I will now open water into the natbaktu-reservoirs, then water will not flow into the town of Irra-gāmil. If I will open water to the natbaku-reservoir, how shall it flow into Dūr-Enlilē, when the kalû-dikes are not done? When my lord inspected the tamirtu land of Dūr-Enlilē, he said thus: “The following: the reed bundles are strong! No one shall ...! To my lord thus I said: "The following: The fields for ... ḫarbu fields of Dūr-Enlilē ...." (And) my lord said thus, the following "They ... placed? ... and Dūr-Nusku ...the errēšu farmers ... of the province of Dūr-Enlilē ..." the kalû-dike of the tamirtu land ... when he threw (down) for them ... They may let it come up ... and the field ... It is not too small! In# ... of my lord ... ... of ... ... ... The following: To Ibni-Amurru ... my lord will send to me ...he will wait for the year ... which is seized ... this dullu work duty ... harvest time the ṣābu work troops ... they stood ... the natbaktu-reservoir? ... for 40 (gur) seeds ... since they were seized at the first time ... they will irrigate above him and ... ... when he will send that of my lord ...

akk: [...] u3 ha-s,a-ar-ti sza [...] [... be]-li2 ki-i sza {d}nin-sar# [...] [...]-szu 1(u) 2(asz) _gur#? sze#_ i-na# [...] [...] be-li2 a-na#? [...]
en: ... and haṣartu wool of ... ... when my lord that of Ninsar-... ... his/him ... 12 (gur) barley in/out of ... ... my lord to (?) ...

akk: [...]-ti sza szi-i-ma x a-na-ku a-nam-din-ma [... ma?]-am-ma il-qa2-am#?-[ma? ...]
en: ... of the price ..., which I gave, and ... somebody (?) took (?) ... and ...

akk: _ARAD#_-ka#{i#} be#-la#-nu# a#-na# di#-na#-an# be#-li2#-ia# lul#-lik# a#-na# _e2#_ u3# _edin#_ sza# be#-li2#-ia# szul#-mu# um#-ma#-a# [a]-na# be-li2#-ia#-ma# har#-bu# t,e#-e#-mi# sza# _en#_-ia# e#-ri#-sza# mah#-ra#-a# ki#-i# i#-ri#-szu# ul# ma#?-lu#-szu# ki#-i# u2#-szi#-szi#-ru# [a?]-szap#-pa#-ra#? i#-na# la# ru#-ub#-bi#-i# u3# la# na#-[s,a]-ri# _gu4#?_ sza#? ul#-ta#-ki#-lu# u3# la# sza#-qe2#-e# sza# me#-e# ih#-ta#-liq# u3# i#-na#-an#-na# [...] u3 _{lu2}apin-mesz_ be-li2 ki-i isz-pu-ra [...] szu-u2 it-ta-at-la-ku [... mi]-ni#? lu#?-di-ka [...] a-na be-li2-ia mah-ra-a [... ma]-as,#-s,a-ri sza har-bu [sza? _gar?_-in? t,e]-e-mi te#-li-tu4 [... lu-u2?] na#-ah-sa-at
en: Your servant Bēlānu: I may go as my lord's substitute! Regarding house and the estates of my lord: They are in a good or der. The following say to my lord: I cultivated the ḫarbu ṭēmi field of my lord. When they seeded the earlier sowing (with the seeder-plow), it wasn’t full for them (?). When I have put everything into order, then I w ill write (to you). While not raising (?) and while not protecting the oxen, which they had fed, and not having irrigated with the water, they have fled! And now ... and the ikkaru farmers,as my lord wrote ... him (?) ... then each of them went ...what may I throw down (for) you (?) ... for my lord the early (sowing?) ... the guards of the ḫarbu fields ( of the šakin?) ṭēmi and the tēlītu revenue ... (and) may it return.

akk: [...] _sze#?_ a#-na#? sza szu-ta-pe-e [...] im-mar u3 sza har-bu t,e-e-mi [...] im-mar u3 _erin2-mesz_ sza a-na _nibru{ki}_ i#-tu#-ur#-ru u3 sza _{iri}ARAD-gaszan{ki}_ i-ta-at-la-ku i-tu-u2-a ma-am-ma ia-'a-nu u3 _erin2-mesz_ sza i-na _uru_ i-ba-asz2-szu-u2 a-na dul-li sza har#-bu t,e-e-mi sza _e2 {disz}{d}3(u)_-ma-gir <<a-na>> ra-ki-is um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia am-mi-ni a-na _gu4-mesz erin2-mesz_-ma ia-'a-nu a-na be-li2-ia al-tap-ra be-li2 lu i-di a-na hi-t,i-ia be-li2 la _gar_-na _u4-mesz_-szu i-gam-ma-ru i-na mi-ni-i lu-di-isz
en: ... barley (?) for the šutāpu workers ... he will see. And that of the ḫarbu ṭēmi field ... he will see. And the ṣābu workers, who returned to Nippur, and those from Arad-bēlti all of them left and besides me there is no one! And regarding the ṣābu workers, who are in the city: they are bound(!) for the dullu work duty of the ḫarbu ṭēmi fields of the province Bīt-Sîn-māgir. (Say) the following to my lord Why are there not any ṣābu workers for the cattle? I have written to my lord. My lord may know. As a criminal act my lord may not place this. They will finnish their days With what may I thresh?

akk: _ARAD_-ka {disz}u-bar-ru3 a-na di-na-an be#-li2#-ia# lul#-lik# um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia-a-ma ha-za-an-nu sza _bad3_-{d}pap-<<szuk>>-sukkal!{ki} nam-ga-ra is-se-[ke]-er a-di szi-it-ta ta-mi-ra-ti sza har#-pi i-sza-aq-qu-u2 u3 2(u) har-bu sza up-pu-li [sza]-ak-nu u3 i-de-ek-ku-u2 [be]-li2 me-e a-a-u2-ti isz-qi2-ma [... lu]-u2 nam-gar-ra is-ki-ir be-li2 lisz-pu-ra-am-ma ta-mi-ir-ta sza i-na lib3-bi-szu u2-ma-al-lu-u2 lisz-qi2 u3 up-pu-la li-sza-ak-li-ma be-li2 mi-ik-ra u3 e-re-sza la i-ha-at,-t,i nam-gar-szu musz-szur u3 szu-u2 a-na pa-an nam-ga-ri sza be-li2-ia a-szi-ib mu-u2 i-na nam-ga-ri-szu2 ma-a'-du u3 szu-u2 a-na pa-an nam-ga-ri an-ni-i a-szi-ib
en: Your servant Ubāru: I may go as my lord’s substitute! The following (say) to my lord: The ḫazannu of Dūr-Pap šukkal has closed the namgāru irrigation canal. Until they will irrigate the two irrigated territories (belonging to the city) of the early (sowing) and (until on) 20 ḫarbu fields of the late (sowing) (water) is placed, and (until) they will levy a workforce (for it). (until then) with what kind of water will my lord irrigate, ... if it is the case that he closed the namgāru irrigation canal? My lord may sent (an order), and he(= the ḫazannu) may irrigate the irrigated territories (surrounding a city), which he has already filled out of his heart (= from his own stocks with seeds), but he may prevent them from (doing the) late (sowing). My lord may not miss the irrigation and the seeding with a seeder-plow (on his own fields). His own(= of the ḫazannu) namgāru irrigation canal is flowing and he is sitting in front of the namgāru irrigation canal (i.e. thereby blocking it) of my lord. The water in his own namgāru irrigation canal is filled up (= enough) and still he is sitting in front of this namgāru irrigation canal!

akk: i-na nam-ga-ri-szu me-e lil-qi2-ma nam-gar-ra sza be-li2-ia li-masz-szi-ir me-e _i7 dingir_-i-pu-usz u3 me-e _i7_ na-la-ah me-e zi-it-ti sza be-li2-ia be-li2 a-na _gu2-en-na_-ki li-iq-bi2-ma a-na qi2-pu-ti lisz-pu-ru-ni-im-ma lid-di-nu-ma e-re-szu la i-ma-at,-t,i
en: Out of his namgāru irrigation canal he may take water and the namgāru irrigation canal of my lord he may make flow (with it). (About) the water of the nāru canal of Ilu-ipuš and the water of the nāru canal Nalaḫ, which is the share of the water of my lord may my lord speak to the šandabakku and he may send for the qīpu officials. They may give (water) and the ploughing must not decrease!

akk: _ARAD_-ka _{disz}du3_-a-sza2-_{d}marduk#_ a-na di-na-an be-li2-ia lul-lik a-na _iri{ki}_ u3 _edin_ sza be-li2-ia szu-ul-mu um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia-ma ad-ru szu-te-su-uk? u3 ma!-hi-s,a-[...]-szu-ma e-pe-[sza? ...] um#-[ma ...]-ma na#-[... a]-na be-li2 x-[...] a-[... _{disz}{d}iszkur_-ra]-im-_numun_
en: Your servant Banâ-ša-Marduk: I may go as my lord's substitute! Regarding the city and (its) hinterland of my lord: everything is in best order. (Speak) the following to my lord: (It) had been thrown down flat on the threshing floor and a māḫiṣu ... to do ... ... and ... to my lord ... Adad-rā’im-zēri

akk: [...] u2-ba#-[...] [na]-du#-u2-ma ki-ki-i ad?#-[...] {disz}e2-sag-il2-s,u2-ri-ia [x-x] _gar_-in-t,e3-mi sza _e2-{disz}{d}3(u)_-ma#-gir# _1(disz) me erin2-hi-a_ gi-in-na-ta ki-i ig-nu-na _erin2-mesz_ sza be-li2-ia ir-ta-pi-is u3 _ka2_ ad-da2-te10-e ib-ta-ta-aq a-na szi-bu-ti-ia _{disz}{d}nergal_-ba-ni ha-za-na sza {iri}ra-ka-be u3 ha-za-an-na sza _e2_ {disz}ki-din-ni asz-ta-ka-an
en: ... [after ... had been thro]wn down ... how ... [...] Esagil-ṣūrīja ... After the šakin-ṭēmi of the province Bīt-Sîn-magir 100 ṣābu workers in a confinement had confined, the ṣābu workers of my lord he beat and the gate of Adattu he broke through. For my witnesses Nergal-bāni, the ḫazannu of Rakābu, and the ḫazannu of Bīt-Kidinnī I have then put up.

akk: a-na be-li2-ia qi2-bi-ma um-ma-a {disz}eri-ba-_{d}marduk ARAD_-ka-ma a-na di-na-an be-li2-ia lul-lik um-ma-a a-na be-li2-ia-ma _lu2-sag-lugal_ sza dul-la u2-sze-ep-pe#-szu14 qi2-pu-ti _ARAD-mesz_-ka lu-u2 sza _nibru{ki}_ _bad3_-ku-ri-gal-zu u3 _iri-ARAD-gaszan_ i-na mu-uh dul-li ka-ri-in-szu2-nu-ti u3 a-szi-ib pa-ni-szu-nu a-na pe-te-e ul i-nam-din-szu-nu-ti lu-u2-s,i de-[ka? ...]
en: Speak to my lord: The following (says) Erība-Marduk, your servant, I may go as my lord's substitute! The following (say) to my lord: The ša rēš šarri, who lets the dullu work duty be carried out, is slowing down the qīpu commissioners, your servants,the ones from Nippur, from Dūr-Kurigalzu and from Āl-Arad-Belti in (them) doing the dullu work duty, and as the one, who is sitting in front of them, to the opening (of channels) he does not give them. I may go out ( and the summoner for workforce?) ...

elx: u2 {disz}un-tasz-{d}gal sza-ak {disz}{d}hu-ban-nu-me-na-ki su-un-ki-ik an-za-an szu-szu-un-ka ta-ak-me u2-me tu4-ur hi-ih si-it-me u2-me szu-ul-lu-me-ka3 az-ki-it tu4-ur sah-ri hu-szu-ia in-ki2 hi-en-ka3 in-ti4-ik-ka3 a-ki2 si-ia-an u2-pa-at hu-us-si-ip-me ku-ku-un-nu-um ub-ku-mi-a ku-szi-ih {d}in-szu-usz-na-ak si-ia-an ku-uk-ra in du-ni-ih u2 zag-ra-tu4-me ki-ik-ki-te-eh hu-ut-tak ha-li-ik u2-me {d}in-szu-usz-na-ak ul-li-na te-la-ak-ni
en: I am Untaš-napiriša, son of Ḫumbannumena, king of Anshan and Susa. Wishing that my life and reign (will) constantly prosper and that the extinction of lineage (at the time of) judgment (?) to me may not be granted, it is for this reason that a temple with baked bricks, a kukunnû with glazed bricks I have built. To Inšušinak of siyan-kuk I gave it. A ziggurat I raised. May my work to Inšušinak be dedicated.
it: Io, Untaš-napiriša, figlio di Humbanumena, re di Anshan e Susa. Affinché io possa ricevere una lunga vita e una salute prospera, affinché io non ottenga la rottura della linea dinastica ho costruito il tempio in mattoni cotti (?) e il kukunum in mattoni smaltati (?) e ho donato il sian-kuk a Inšušinak. Io la ziggurat ho innalzato e ne ho fatto offerta (possa essere gradita) a Inšušinak per la sua benevolenza.
fr: Moi, Untaš-napiriša, fils de Humbanumena, roi d'Anzan et de Suse, désireux (que) ma vie (soit) continuellement de prospérité, pout qu'il ne me soit pas octroyé l'extinction de la lignée (quand elle sera) jugée (?), c'est dans cette intention que j'ai bâti un temple en briques cuites, un temple-haut aux briques émaillées; j'en ai fait don à Inšušinak du siyan-kuk. Moi une ziggourat j'ai élevé. Que l'œuvre que j'ai réalisée soit, en offrande de ma part, agréable à Inšušinak!

en: ... appearing like (?) the sun, May it (?) truly be a miracle (?). Young hero Utu, lord who makes decisions in heavens and on earth, Suen-iddinam -he may be your helper for all isues- the king, the counsellor, who is greatly knowledgable, May he (Utu) look favourably at you.   When you bestowed eternal years (?) / an eternal name (?) (and) ... ...standing fit for... ... ... lying... ... ... who does not submit to him, who makes..., its... and its inscription perfect after Nidaba, the queen of...wisdom will give wisdom to him,   she will bestow beautiful hands, the joy of scribal arts upon him. (For) Suen-iddinam, your beloved, young hero Utu, the [shepherd] of the black-headed [people], ...of the land... makes firm for you. Suen-iddinam righteous [shepherd] of his? land... ...
